contentrichtext.text: {{Taxobox | name = Rustic Bunting | image =Emberiza rustica2.jpg | status = LC | status_system = IUCN3.1 | status_ref = <ref>{{IUCN|id=106008952 |title=''Emberiza rustica'' |assessors=[[BirdLife International]] |version=2012.1 |year=2012 |accessdate=16 July 2012}}</ref> | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Chordate|Chordata]] | classis = [[bird|Aves]] | ordo = [[Passeriformes]] | familia = [[Emberizidae]] | genus = ''[[Emberiza]]'' | species = '''''E. rustica''''' | binomial = ''Emberiza rustica'' | binomial_authority = [[Peter Simon Pallas|Pallas]], 1776 }} [[File:Emberiza rustica MHNT.ZOO.2011.11.219 Suomussalmi.jpg|thumb|''Emberiza rustica'' [[MHNT]]]] The '''Rustic Bunting''' (''Emberiza rustica'') is a [[passerine]] [[bird]] in the [[bunting (bird)|bunting]] family Emberizidae, a group now separated by most modern authors from the [[finch]]es, Fringillidae. It breeds across northern [[Europe]] and [[Asia]]. It is [[bird migration|migratory]], wintering in south east Asia, [[Japan]], and eastern [[China]]. It is a rare wanderer to western Europe. It breeds in wet [[conifer]]ous woodland. 4-6 eggs are laid in a nest in a bush or on the ground. Its natural food consists of insects when feeding young, and otherwise seeds. This bird is similar in size to a [[Reed Bunting]]. It has white underparts with reddish flank, pink legs and a pink lower mandible. The summer male has a black head with a white throat and supercilium and a reddish breast band. The female has a heavily streaked brown back and brown face with a whitish supercilium. She resembles a female Reed Bunting, but has the reddish flank streaks, a chestnut nape and a pink, not grey, lower mandible. The call is a distinctive ''zit'', and the song is a melancholic ''delee-deloo-delee''. == References == {{Reflist}} == External links == * [http://orientalbirdimages.org/search.php?action=searchresult&Bird_ID=1945 OBC] 11 photographs (see pulldown menu at page bottom) {{wikispecies|Emberiza rustica}} {{commons|Emberiza rustica}} [[Category:Emberiza]] [[Category:Birds of Europe]] [[Category:Birds of Iceland]] [[Category:Birds of Turkey]] [[Category:Birds of Asia]] [[Category:Birds of Japan]]
